page.title: 12INTERVIEW WITH MRS SARNEY
page.content: Mrs Sarney's father was interested in local history.He first wrote articles for the Church Parish Magazine.People said he ought to put them together as a book so he did-50 years ago.Since then Sunningdale has tripled in size. Mrs Sarney has lived in Sunningdale all her life and has lived in the same house-Pennington for all that time.She was the youngest of 9 children living at Pennington(originally a Post Office ).Her family stayed here during the war but she went away for 3 years . Several bombs were dropped on the village.One was dropped outside a house called Dale Lodge and one came down behind the Church-it survived!In order to write the book Mr Hodder looked up many sources,including old documents,books and newspapers.One of the books was called 'The Forest of Sunninghill'one of only 400 printed.
